intro: Erigeron hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron hartwegii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
